required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mobility Training Using a Bionic Knee Orthosis in Patients Chronic Post-Stroke: A Case Series

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study examined the effect of task-oriented mobility training in three persons chronic post-stroke using a novel, wearable, mobile intention-based robotic orthosis (Tibion Bionic Leg).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
primary_outcome.description: Ambulation speed, in meters per second, as obtained by the Ten (10) Meter Walk Test (10 MWT). The 10 MWT measures the time required to walk 10 meters at the subject's comfortable walking pace.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: The total distance walked by the patient, in meters, as obtained by the Six (6) Minute Walk Test (6 MWT). The 6 MWT is performed over level ground, using any walking aids (canes, walkers, etc.) the patient requires for comfortable walking.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: The time, in seconds, for the patient to rise from sitting in a standard arm chair, walk 3 meters, turn around, walk back to the chair, and sit down. This evaluation is called the Timed Up and Go test (TUG). The patient may wear their usual footwear and use any aids (canes, walkers, etc.) they typically employ for comfortable walking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Five Times Sit to Stand Test (5 x STS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: The time, in seconds, for the patient to rise from a seated to full standing position and return to sitting five times in rapid succession. This evaluation is called the Five Times Sit to Stand Test (5 x STS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: The length of the patient's average step, in meters, as measured during comfortable walking.

arm_group.description: Arm of the study in which enrolled post-stroke subjects undergo rehabilitative therapy with the Tibion Bionic Leg.

intervention.description: A programmable, carbon-fiber robotic leg orthosis (Tibion Bionic Leg, Tibion Corporation, Sunnyvale, CA) was used during therapy to actively supplement concentric and eccentric quadriceps function on the participant's impaired side. The device uses internal sensors at the foot and knee joint to detect intention of movement and, once a variable force threshold is passed, the devices provides appropriate assistive and resistive adjustments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- Aged 40 to 60 years
- One year status post-stroke
- Able to walk at least 10 meters
- Independence in self-care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medically unstable
- Major cardiopulmonary deficiency
- Major depression
- Significant cognitive deficit
- Currently receiving gait training
- Younger than 40 years of age
- Older than 60 years of age
- Unable to walk at least 10 meters

facility.name: Bakar Community Center at the University of California San Francisco

reference.citation: Wong CK, Bishop L, Stein J. A wearable robotic knee orthosis for gait training: a case-series of hemiparetic stroke survivors. Prosthet Orthot Int. 2012 Mar;36(1):113-20. doi: 10.1177/0309364611428235. Epub 2011 Nov 14.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were part of the hospitals patient population.

group.title: Tibion Arm Baseline Assessments
group.description: Arm of the study in which enrolled post-stroke subjects undergo rehabilitative therapy with the Tibion Bionic Leg.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All subjects had reached plateau with conventional Bodyweight-Supported Treadmill Training (BWSTT, participated in task-oriented mobility therapy(1.5 hours, 2-4 times per week for 4 weeks) with Robotic Leg Orthosis (RLO) under the supervision of a physical therapist.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: The Baseline measurement is to specify the gender of each participant.

measure.title: Lower Left Extremity Strength
measure.description: The strength of the left lower extremity during active extension in pounds-force (lbf).

measure.title: Right Lower Extremity Strength
measure.description: The strength of the right lower extremity during active extension in pounds-force (lbf).

measure.title: Resting Extensor Tone (Modified Ashworth Scale)
measure.description: The Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) measures muscle hypertonia, with increasing scores signifying greater resting tone of muscle groups. Scores: 0 - No tone, 1 - Slight tone, with by a catch and release or by minimal resistance at the end of the range of motion, 1+ - Slight tone, manifested by a catch, followed by minimal resistance through less than half of the ROM, 2 - Marked increase in tone through most of ROM, but affected limb(s) easily moved, 3 - Considerable tone, passive movement difficult, 4 - Affected limb(s) rigid in flexion or extension

outcome.title: 6 Minute Walk Test (6 MWT)
outcome.description: The total distance walked by the patient, in meters, as obtained by the Six (6) Minute Walk Test (6 MWT). The 6 MWT is performed over level ground, using any walking aids (canes, walkers, etc.) the patient requires for comfortable walking.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to training); at conclusion of 4 week training regimen (1.5 hours/session with 2 to 4 sessions per week); and 1 Month post-training regimen.
outcome.population: Three (3) Subjects all of whom had a plateaued with conventional Bodyweight-Supported Treadmill Training (BWSTT) participated in task-oriented mobility therapy (1.5 hours, 2-4 times per week for 4 weeks) with the Tibion Bionic Leg under the supervision of a physical therapist.

outcome.description: The time, in seconds, for the patient to rise from sitting in a standard arm chair, walk 3 meters, turn around, walk back to the chair, and sit down. This evaluation is called the Timed Up and Go test (TUG). The patient may wear their usual footwear and use any aids (canes, walkers, etc.) they typically employ for comfortable walking.

This evaluation is called the Timed Up and Go test (TUG). The patient may wear their usual footwear and use any aids (canes, walkers, etc.) they typically employ for comfortable walking.

outcome.description: The time, in seconds, for the patient to rise from a seated to full standing position and return to sitting five times in rapid succession. This evaluation is called the Five Times Sit to Stand Test (5 x STS)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: These results are from a small group (n of 3) of patients and should not be assumed to be consistent across all populations. Furthermore, the inherent subjective variability of patient response in physical therapy interventions should be considered.

point_of_contact.organization: Department of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation, University of California San Francisco
